boat.name: Caplin
boat.full_description:
Commander Robert D. Graham commissioned 'Caplin', intending to sail round the world. He sold the yacht when he reached Wellington, New Zealand in 1940 to Mr GT Gillies.

In 1992, 'Caplin' was offered for sale, having been in GT Gillies' ownership for over 50 years, with 'a very full inventory including original dinghy, compasses, etc.' The advert appeared in the Old Gaffers Association Newsletter at a price of 69,000 NZ dollars.
boat.construction_details: Pitch pine on oak copper sheathed. Iron ballast
boat.short_description: 'Caplin' was designed and built by Andrew Anderson & Son of Penarth, Wales, in 1937.
